data.title: Unmasked: doctor who was real life Hannibal Lecter
data.meta_description: The man who provided the inspiration for Hannibal Lecter, the cannibal serial killer from The Silence of the Lambs, was a gay Mexican doctor who ended his days treating the poor and desperately
data.text:
The man who provided the inspiration for Hannibal Lecter, the cannibal serial killer from The Silence of the Lambs, was a gay Mexican doctor who ended his days treating the poor and desperately trying to forget his dark past.

His name was Alfredo Ballí Treviño, The Times can disclose. He died in 2009 at 81. As a young man he had served 20 years in prison for murder in the Penal del Topo Chico in Monterrey, Mexico. It was during that time that Thomas Harris, the author of The Silence of the Lambs, would meet him.
